A necessidade de se preyer 0 destino de produtos quimicos nos recursos naturais,
especificamente no solo e na agua, tern levado muitos pesquisadores a conceberem e utilizarem
modelos de simulavao do movimento de solutos. Neste trabalho utilizou-se 0 modelo
deterministico LEACHM-P (Leaching Estimation and Chemistry Mode1- Pesticide) para simular 0
movimento de solutos no solo. 0 mode1o foi calibrado para as condivoes edafo-ambientais
brasileiras, adaptando-se parametros, visto que 0 mesmo nao foi originalmente desenvolvido para
estas condivoes. Para os experimentos realizados foram utilizados nove lisimetros, expostos a
algumas condivoes ambientais controladas, constituidos de blocos de solo envolvidos por caixas
apropriadas. Foram divididos em conjuntos de tres, tendo cada conjunto, lisimetros de urn metro
de diametro por 45, 90 e 180 cm de profundidade. Cada urn dos conjuntos continha urn solo
caracteristico do Estado de Sao Paulo: Pindorama, Monte Alegre do SuI e Ribeirao Preto. Para a
caracterizavao do potencial de agua do solo em funvao da umidade foram coletadas amostras dos
tres solos, utilizando-se cilindros de ferro de 4 cm de diametro e 3 cm de altura, que foram
introduzidos longitudinalmente nas profundidades desejadas. 0 monitoramento do potencial de

dos dados obtidos, foi obtida a curva de potencial matricial em funvao do tempo, para cada solo.
Na parte inferior de cada lisimetro existe uma tubulavao que permite coletar 0 efluente para as
profundidades de 45, 90 e 180 cm. Utilizando-se esta facilidade foram obtidas, para cada uma das

The necessity to predict the fate of chemical products in the environment, particulary in soil
and water, has led many researchers to the use of models for the simulation of solute transport. In
this work, the deterministic model LEACHM-P (Leaching Estimation and Chemistry Model -
Pesticide) is used to simulate the movement of solutes in soil. Because the model was not originally
developed for Brazilian environmental conditions, it was first calibrated through the adaptation of
various parameters. Experiments were carried out using nine lysimeters under controlled
environmental conditions. The lysimeters were divided into three groups with in each group one
lysimeter of 45, 90 and 180 cm depth. Each lysimeter group contained a different soil, typical of
the state of Sao Paulo: Pindorama, monte Alegre do SuI and Ribeirao Preto. In order to determine
the relationship between the water potencial and the soil moisture content, samples were collected
of all three soil types, using iron cylinders with a diameter of 4 cm and a height of 3 cm, which
were inserted horizontally, at the desired depths. The water potential was measured with
tensiometers, of which two were installed in each lysimeter. From resultants measurements the
matric potencial was obtained as a function of time. A drainpipe underneath each lysimeter enabled
the collection of eflluent at 45, 90 and 180 cm depth. Using this facility, the soil solution could be
sampled at each of these three depths, at regular time intervals. A comparison between the
measured data and the data simulated with LEACHM-P model adapted for the tropical conditions
found in Brasil, enabled the adjustment of retention curves and matric potencial curves as a
function of depth, for the soils of Pindorama and Monte Alegre do SuI. Moreover, the model was
able to simulate, for these two soils, the concentration of Atrazine ( the most used pesticide in corn
and wheat culture) as a function of time and depth, in accordance with the measured concentration
values. For Ribeirao Preto soil, the adjustment of retention curves and matric potencial curves as a
function of depth, were not sufficient to a good calibration.
